publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1296 Maureen Macmillan: Christian Aid Week-That the Parliament commends Christian Aid who work in over 55 countries helping people, regardless of religion or race, to improve their lives and tackle the causes of poverty and injustice; notes that Christian Aid week is 9 to 15 May 2004 and highlights the need to help those in the world's poorest countries to help themselves; further notes, in particular, the work Christian Aid is undertaking in Sierra Leone, the world's poorest country, to help ensure sustainable peace, and calls on the Scottish Executive to make representations to Her Majesty's Government to make available further resources to assist overseas development in order to eradicate inequality in the world's poorest countries. Supported by: Donald Gorrie*

S2M-1296 Christian Aid Week (lodged on 11 May 2004) Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Shiona Baird*, Richard Baker*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Dr Jean Turner*, Mark Ballard*, Rosie Kane*, Mike Rumbles*, Michael McMahon*, Eleanor Scott*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Christine Grahame*, Tricia Marwick*, Brian Adam*, Karen Gillon*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Robert Brown*, Linda Fabiani*, Margaret Jamieson*, Robin Harper*, Pauline McNeill*, Rhona Brankin*, Bruce Crawford*, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-1296 Christian Aid Week (lodged on 11 May 2004) Mary Scanlon*, Cathie Craigie*, Fiona Hyslop*, Karen Whitefield*, Mike Pringle*, Jackie Baillie*, Mike Watson*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Marlyn Glen*

S2M-1296 Maureen Macmillan: Christian Aid Week-That the Parliament commends Christian Aid who work in over 55 countries helping people, regardless of religion or race, to improve their lives and tackle the causes of poverty and injustice; notes that Christian Aid week is 9 to 15 May 2004 and highlights the need to help those in the world's poorest countries to help themselves; further notes, in particular, the work Christian Aid is undertaking in Sierra Leone, the world's poorest country, to help ensure sustainable peace, and calls on the Scottish Executive to make representations to Her Majesty's Government to make available further resources to assist overseas development in order to eradicate inequality in the world's poorest countries. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Shiona Baird, Richard Baker, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Dr Jean Turner, Mark Ballard, Rosie Kane, Mike Rumbles, Michael McMahon, Eleanor Scott, Ms Wendy Alexander, Christine Grahame, Tricia Marwick, Brian Adam, Karen Gillon, Dr Elaine Murray, Robert Brown, Linda Fabiani, Margaret Jamieson, Robin Harper, Pauline McNeill, Rhona Brankin, Bruce Crawford, Ms Sandra White, Mary Scanlon, Cathie Craigie, Fiona Hyslop, Karen Whitefield, Mike Pringle, Jackie Baillie, Mike Watson, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Marlyn Glen
S2M-1296 Christian Aid Week (lodged on 11 May 2004) Trish Godman*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-1296 Christian Aid Week (lodged on 11 May 2004) Alex Neil*, Chris Ballance*
S2M-1296 Christian Aid Week (lodged on 11 May 2004) Scott Barrie*, Susan Deacon*
S2M-1296 Christian Aid Week (lodged on 11 May 2004) Elaine Smith*
S2M-1296 Christian Aid Week (lodged on 11 May 2004) Cathy Peattie*
